item.title: Reserve Tank Fuel Quantity Indicating Systems (Flight Deck) – Reserve Tanks 2 and 3 Empty

remarks.para: May be inoperative with reserve tanks 2 and 3 empty provided:

numlitem.para: Takeoff weight is limited to a maximum of 785,000 lbs (356,000 kgs),
Remaining individual tank quantity indications are available.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Total Fuel quantity indication may also be inoperative, if so:
Total fuel quantity must be calculated and manually initialized on the FMC PERF INIT page.
If it necessary to jettison fuel:
Record the FUEL TO REMAIN quantity selected for the jettison operation.
Wait two minutes after fuel jettison is complete and then manually re-initialize the FMC with the total FUEL TO REMAIN quantity recorded above.
In case of en route failure of the FMC calculated total fuel quantity, fuel crew must keep a fuel log for the remainder of the flight.

note.para: The PROGRESS page 1 display of Fuel quantity and actual time of arrival (ATA) at the last waypoint prior to failure may be used as a starting point. In some failure modes, PROGRESS page 2 FUEL USED data may be available.

numlitem.para: Center tank override/jettison pumps must be OFF for takeoff.

note.para: CWT fuel included as part of ZFW may be used en route.

numlitem.para: Actual takeoff weight cannot exceed 785,000 lbs.
Center Wing Tank fuel must be included as part of ZFW but is considered usable en route.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "RES TANK #2 or #3 FUEL QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
